channel.title: Need help changing something in my client *urgent*
channel.description:
ok i need help changing the thing outlined in red [img]http://img406.imageshack.us/img406/7236/67511912ge5.jpg[/img]
and yea i know its from something else but it was a open source and client... i need to know how to change it and can i change the little pic next to it

item.title: Need help changing something in my client *urgent*
item.dc:creator: @nhonho nhonho
item.description:
@nhonho wrote:

On another topic

Open up each file and search for setTitle(". In one of the files, you will find the frame’s title name, and change it to whaever you want to name it, or simply call the setTitle() method again, and it will rename your frame upon initialization.

ok still dont quite get it ive gotta open up all my .java files and change each and every one?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 08, 2008, 10:26:07 pm[/size][hr]dont worry i figured it out

Read full topic
item.source: Need help changing something in my client *urgent*

item.title: Need help changing something in my client *urgent*
item.dc:creator: @nhonho nhonho
item.description:
@nhonho wrote:

[quote=“Coder xynt, post:1, topic:242221”]It’s a method in the JavaDocs, which is located in the javax.swing package. It is used to give the specified Frame a title. Search for that code within your files.
If the class extends ‘javax.swing.JFrame’ or ‘java.awt.Frame’, then it will either be called using the ‘this’ keyword, or simple doing ‘setTitle(string);’[/quote]

sorry but im completly new to this and i dont quite get ya can u post a small tut?

Read full topic
item.source: Need help changing something in my client *urgent*

item.description:
